oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Testimonial by David Brisendine re: James Venable's Confederate service
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Brisendine certifies that he was a captain of Co. F (I?" 10th Tenn. Cav. CSA and that Venable "was a member of my co. and a faithful soldier that after our surrender at Jackson, Tenn. we were carried to Paducah, Ky. and there paroled May 20, 1865." This handwritten affadavit was probably for notarizing or registering with an official of the Henry County government.
